poem:
Title: Imagined Stills from Un Amore

Two wanderers once met 
in the summer heat,
melting into a mad Italian sonnet.
Time spun, spinning
Bologna under their feet,
where sparks turned smoky,
flickering still.

Marriage-knots tied,
children born in between,
life, a crowded canvas stirring.
Yet in the pool of memory,
that European summer glimmers,
the actors retreating
into a woozy, escapist dream.
